name: allegheny-county-hydrology-lines
notes:
The Hydrology Feature Dataset contains photogrammetrically compiled waterrndrainage features and structures including rivers, streams, drainage canals,rnlocks, dams, lakes, ponds, reservoirs and mooring cells. Rivers, Lakes, Ponds,rnReservoirs, Hidden Lakes, Reservoirs or Ponds: If greater than 25 feet and lessrnthan 30 feet wide, is captured as a double line stream. If greater than 30 feetrnwide it is captured as a river. Lakes are large standing bodies of waterrngreater than 5 acres in size. Ponds are large standing bodies of water greaterrnthan 1 acre and less than 5 acres in size. Polygons are created from Streamrnedges and River Edges.u00a0 The Ohio River,rnMonongahela River and Allegheny River are coded as Major Rivers. All otherrnRiver and Stream polygons are coded as River. If a stream is less than 25 feetrnwide it is placed as a single line and coded as a Stream.u00a0 Both sides of the stream are digitized andrncoded as a Stream for Streams whose width is greater than 25 feet.u00a0 River edges are digitized and coded as River.rnA Drainage Canal is a manmade or channelized hydrographic feature.u00a0 Drainage Canals are differentiated fromrnstreams in that drainage canals have had the sides and/or bottom stabilized tornprevent erosion for the predominant length of the feature.u00a0 Streams may have had some stabilization done,rnbut are primarily in a natural state. Lakes are large standing bodies of waterrngreater than five acres in size.u00a0 Ponds arernlarge standing bodies of water greater than one acre in size and less than fivernacres in size.u00a0 Reservoirs are manmadernembankments of water.u00a0 Included in thisrndefinition are both covered and uncovered water tanks. Reservoirs that arerngreater than one acre in size are digitized. Hidden Streams, Hidden Rivers andrnHidden Drainage Canal or Culverts are those areas of drainage where the waterrnflows through a manmade facility such as a culvert. Hydrology Annotation is notrnbeing updated but will be preserved.u00a0 Ifrna drainage feature has been removed, as apparent on the aerial photography, thernassociated drainage name annotation will be removed. A Mooring Cell is arnstructure to which tows can tie off while awaiting lockage.u00a0 They are normally constructed of concrete andrnsteel and are anchored to the river bottom by means of gravity or sheet piling.rnMooring Cells do not currently exist in the Allegheny County dataset but willrnbe added. Locks are devices that are used to control flow or access to arnhydrologic feature.u00a0 The edges of thernLock are captured.u00a0 Dams are devices thatrnare used to hold or delay the natural flow of water.u00a0 The edges of the Dam are shown.

rnrn

If viewing this description on the Western PennsylvaniarnRegional Data Centeru2019s open data portal (
>http://www.wprdc.org), thisrndataset is harvested on a weekly basis from Allegheny Countyu2019s GIS data portalrn(

>http://openac.alcogis.opendata.arcgis.com/). Thernfull metadata record for this dataset can also be found on Allegheny Countyu2019srnGIS portal. You can access the metadata record and other resources on the GISrnportal by clicking on the u201cExploreu201d button (and choosing the u201cGo to resourceu201drnoption) to the right of the u201cArcGIS Open Datasetu201d text below.

Development Notes:u00a0 Original Lakes and Drainage datasets combinedrnto create this layer. Data was updated as a result of a flyover in the springrnof 2004. A database field has been defined for all map features namedrn"Update Year". This database field will define which dataset providedrneach map feature. Map features from the current map will be set torn"2004". The earlier dataset map features the earlier dataset map featuresrnused to supplement the area near the county boundary will be set torn"1993". All new or modified map data will have the value forrn"Update Year" set to "2004".u00a0

extras.value: Allegheny County / City of Pittsburgh / Western PA Regional Data Center

organization.description: Allegheny County (Pennsylvania) and the City of Pittsburgh both publish their data through the Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center. The Western Pennsylvania Regional Data Center supports key community initiatives by making public information easier to find and use. The Data Center maintains Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburghu2019s open data portal, and provides a number of services to data publishers and users. The Data Center also hosts datasets from these and other public sector agencies, academic institutions, and non-profit organizations. The Data Center is managed by the University of Pittsburghu2019s Center for Social and Urban Research, and is a partnership of the University, Allegheny County and the City of Pittsburgh.
